benchmark_details.name: QAEdit
benchmark_details.overview: QAEdit is a benchmark tailored for real-world QA tasks, designed to assess model editing in large language models (LLMs) and to expose limitations in synthetic evaluation practices.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously assess model editing methods in real-world question answering scenarios and to expose pitfalls of synthetic evaluation methods.

data.source: Constructed from three widely-used QA datasets: Natural Questions, TriviaQA, and SimpleQA.
data.annotation: Extracted subjects from the questions using GPT-4, paraphrased prompts, and selected unrelated QA pairs for locality evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the success rate of edited LLMs on previously failed questions in QA tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of the editing methods in real-world QA settings.
methodology.baseline_results: Average accuracy of existing editing methods was found to be significantly lower than previously reported results under synthetic evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used in the research is publicly available and does not raise any privacy concerns.
